org.epics.pvData.pv
Interface PVDataCreate

public interface PVDataCreate

Create PVField field implementations.

Author:
mrk

Method Detail

createPVField

PVField createPVField(PVStructure parent,
                      Field field)
Create a PVField using given Field introspection data.

Parameters:
parent - The parent interface.
field - The introspection data to be used to create PVField.
Returns:
The PVField implementation.

createPVField

PVField createPVField(PVStructure parent,
                      java.lang.String fieldName,
                      PVField fieldToClone)
Create a PVField using given a PVField to clone. This method calls the appropriate createPVScalar, createPVArray, or createPVStructure.

Parameters:
parent - The parent interface.
fieldToClone - The field to clone.
Returns:
The PVField implementation

createPVScalar

PVScalar createPVScalar(PVStructure parent,
                        Scalar scalar)
Create an implementation of a scalar field reusing the Scalar introspection interface.

Parameters:
parent - The parent.
scalar - The introspection interface.
Returns:
The PVScalar implementation.

createPVScalar

PVScalar createPVScalar(PVStructure parent,
                        java.lang.String fieldName,
                        ScalarType fieldType)
Create an implementation of a scalar field. A Scalar introspection interface is created.

Parameters:
parent - The parent interface.
fieldName - The field name.
fieldType - The field type.
Returns:
The PVScalar implementation.

createPVScalar

PVScalar createPVScalar(PVStructure parent,
                        java.lang.String fieldName,
                        PVScalar scalarToClone)
Create an implementation of a scalar field by cloning an existing PVScalar. The new PVScalar will have the same value and auxInfo as the original.

Parameters:
parent - The parent interface.
fieldName - The field name.
scalarToClone - The PVScalar to clone.
Returns:
The PVScalar implementation.

                      Array array)
Create an implementation of an array field reusing the Array introspection interface.

Parameters:
parent - The parent interface.
array - The introspection interface.
Returns:
The PVArray implementation.

createPVArray

PVArray createPVArray(PVStructure parent,
                      java.lang.String fieldName,
                      ScalarType elementType)
Create an implementation for an array field. An Array introspection interface is created.

Parameters:
parent - The parent interface.
fieldName - The field name.
elementType - The element type.
Returns:
The PVArray implementation.

createPVArray

PVArray createPVArray(PVStructure parent,
                      java.lang.String fieldName,
                      PVArray arrayToClone)
Create an implementation of an array field by cloning an existing PVArray. The new PVArray will have the same value and auxInfo as the original.

Parameters:
parent - The parent interface.
fieldName - The field name.
arrayToClone - The PVArray to clone.
Returns:
The PVArray implementation.

                              java.lang.String fieldName,
                              Structure structure)
Create implementation for PVStructure.

Parameters:

fieldName - The field name.
structure - The introspection interface.
Returns:
The PVStructure implementation

createPVStructure

PVStructure createPVStructure(PVStructure parent,
                              java.lang.String fieldName,
                              Field[] fields)
Create implementation for PVStructure.

Parameters:
parent - The parent interface.
fieldName - The field name.
fields - Array of reflection interfaces for the subFields.
Returns:
The PVStructure implementation

createPVStructure

PVStructure createPVStructure(PVStructure parent,
                              java.lang.String fieldName,
                              PVStructure structToClone)
Create implementation for PVStructure.

Parameters:
parent - The parent interface.
fieldName - The field name.
structToClone - A structure. Each subfield and any auxInfo is cloned and added to the newly created structure.
Returns:
The PVStructure implementation.

createPVStructure

PVStructure createPVStructure(PVStructure parent,
                              java.lang.String fieldName,
                              PVDatabase pvDatabase,
                              java.lang.String structureName)
Create implementation for PVStructure.

Parameters:
parent - The parent interface.
fieldName - The field name.
pvDatabase - The database where structureName is located.
structureName - The structure with this name is found in pvDatabase. Each subfield and any auxInfo is cloned and added to the newly created structure.
Returns:
The PVStructure implementation.

createPVRecord

PVRecord createPVRecord(java.lang.String recordName,
                        Field[] fields)
Create a record instance.

Parameters:
recordName - The instance name.
fields - Array of reflection interfaces for the subFields.
Returns:
The interface for accessing the record instance.

createPVRecord

PVRecord createPVRecord(java.lang.String recordName,
                        PVStructure structToClone)
Create a record instance.

Parameters:
recordName - The instance name.
structToClone - A structure. Each subfield and any auxInfo is cloned and added to the newly created structure.
Returns:
The interface for accessing the record instance.

createPVRecord

PVRecord createPVRecord(java.lang.String recordName,
                        PVDatabase pvDatabase,
                        java.lang.String structureName)
Create a record instance.

Parameters:
recordName - The instance name.
pvDatabase - The database where structureName is located.
structureName - The structure with this name is located in pvDatabase. Each subfield and any auxInfo is cloned and added to the newly created structure.
Returns:
The interface for accessing the record instance.

flattenPVStructure

PVField[] flattenPVStructure(PVStructure pvStructure)
Get a PVField[] that has all field of pvStructure in offset order.

Parameters:
pvStructure - The structure.
Returns:
The array of PVField in offset order.
